item.title: The Shadow AI Surge: Study Finds 50% of Workers Use Unapproved AI Tools
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
With unapproved AI tools entrenched in daily workflows, experts say itâ€™s time to shift from monitoring to managing Shadow AI use across the enterprise.

The post The Shadow AI Surge: Study Finds 50% of Workers Use Unapproved AI Tools appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of April 14, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of April 14, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: In Other News: 4chan Hacked, Android Auto-Reboot, Nemesis Admin Charged
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: 4chan hacked, auto-reboot security feature coming to Android, Iranian administrator of Nemesis charged in US.

The post In Other News: 4chan Hacked, Android Auto-Reboot, Nemesis Admin Charged appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cy4Data Labs Raises $10 Million to Secure Data in Use
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Data protection firm Cy4Data Labs has raised $10 million in a Series A funding round led by Pelion Venture Partners.

The post Cy4Data Labs Raises $10 Million to Secure Data in Use appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Events Giant Legends International Hacked
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Legends International says the personal information of employees and customers was compromised as a result of a cyberattack.

The post Events Giant Legends International Hacked appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ahold Delhaize Confirms Data Stolen in Ransomware Attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ahold Delhaize has confirmed that data was stolen from its systems in November 2024 after a ransomware group claimed the attack.

The post Ahold Delhaize Confirms Data Stolen in Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Fresh Windows NTLM Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A Windows NTLM vulnerability patched in March has been exploited in attacks targeting government and private institutions.

The post Fresh Windows NTLM Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Man Helped Individuals in China Get Jobs Involving Sensitive US Government Projects
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Minh Phuong Ngoc Vong pleaded guilty to defrauding US companies of roughly $1 million in a fake IT worker scheme.

The post Man Helped Individuals in China Get Jobs Involving Sensitive US Government Projects appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Demystifying Security Posture Management
item.dc:creator: Torsten George
item.description:
While the Security Posture Management buzz is real, its long-term viability depends on whether it can deliver measurable outcomes without adding more complexity.

The post Demystifying Security Posture Management appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Vulnerabilities Patched in Atlassian, Cisco Products
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Atlassian and Cisco have released patches for multiple high-severity vulnerabilities, including remote code execution bugs.

The post Vulnerabilities Patched in Atlassian, Cisco Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical Erlang/OTP SSH Flaw Exposes Many Devices to Remote Hacking
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Servers exposed to complete takeover due to CVE-2025-32433, an unauthenticated remote code execution flaw in Erlang/OTP SSH.

The post Critical Erlang/OTP SSH Flaw Exposes Many Devices to Remote Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.
